newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria willing to join Albania force.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria willing to join Albania force.

text.p: Bulgaria said on Thursday it was prepared to contribute troops to an international security force to protect relief supplies to Albania.

Italy, France, Greece, Turkey, Spain, Romania and Austria have already offered to contribute troops. Any Bulgarian participation would require approval from the new parliament after general elections set for April 19.

"Bulgaria's government declares that Bulgaria is prepared to take part in a suitable form in the international forces which were set up under Resolution 1101 (1997) of the United Nations Security Council," a government statement said.
It said the decision reflected Bulgaria's concern for stability in the Balkan region and its desire for integration in the European Union and NATO.
